1.12.2.0.0.5:
- Changes -
Post "mini-arms" now behave like the ones from IE.
  As you'd expect them to.
Being a perfectionist with textures.
  Aka got rid of what apeared to be Stretching when looking at the top-most blocks.
Some more opimization, mostly with the way "connections" are checked for the arms.
  It's now X amount of times faster. Yes, im not sure by how much.
  But i definitely noticed less lag when placing blocks near posts. (I have a potato, so i notice that stuff fairly easily)
1.12.2.0.0.4-01:
- Additions -
IE Manual Entry

- Changes -
Generaly optimizing a few things here and there.

- Fixes -
Tooltip now displays correctly.
Mini-Arms now don't apear anymore when a multiblock structure from IE is next to it.
Missing texture on the bottom side of the top post cap.
Creative Tab now has the correct name.
1.12.2.0.0.4:
Finaly added these mini-arm that apear on the posts themself. (When you attach for example a lever to them)

So now it's (technicaly) feature-complete.
1.12.2.0.0.3:
- Changes -
Made arms less.. fiddly. (I hope)

- Fixes -
Item model is finaly visible to the world!

I know: Just for that?
Why?
I planned to add something else too but it will take longer than i first thought.
1.12.2.0.0.2:
- Additions -
Setup update notification stuff. (Now whenever a new version is released you'll be notified in-game.)
Added recipe for the Extendable Post prematurely. (Mind that the item still doesnt display correctly!)

- Changes -
Changed versioning scheme to fit the update notfication stuff. (Starting with 0.0.2)

- Fixes -
Right-clicking an arm with a fence, and another arm being directly above it, won't spawn a post ontop of the second arm.
Right-clicking an upside-down arm with a fence won't place a post above it.
1.12.2.0.0.1.001:
- Fixes - 
Arms now correctly display upside down when a block is below it.
Arms don't flip if a block is already above it.
Post Top doesnt change to normal Post when an Arm is above it.

Now requires ImmersiveEngineering 0.12 or Higher. (Instead of ImmersiveEngineering 0.12-8)
